item.title: Contribute!
item.description: Want to get involved? Here are the ways you can contribute to the project: Post your stories and pictures to Instagram with the #Niagara2022Stories hashtag, or with any of the hashtags on our Data page. These posts will be automatically harvested and archived for posterity No social media? No problem! Post your content directly to our repository.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Have a question or a comment? Please use the form below to get in touch with us. Interested in contributing your stories? Please see the Contribute page. Your Name Email Address An email address is required. Message

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Jonathan Younker, and I’m a librarian at Brock University, located in St. Catharines, Ontario. I received a research grant through the VPR Canada Games Grants program for this project. Goals We’re collecting as much data as possible about the Niagara 2022 Summer Games with the hope that it proves useful to researchers in the future. With the help of Research Assistant Danielle Merasty, we aim to identify, collect, organize and disseminate quantitative and qualitative data about the Games — and by extension, life in Niagara — before, during and after the Games themselves.

item.title: Content
item.description: Instagram We’re currently harvesting specific Instagram accounts and hashtags: #Niagara2022 #Niagara2022Stories #2022CSG #2022CanadaGames #CanadaGamesPark #2022CanadaSummerGames 2022CanadaGames Niagara2022Stories Twitter Twitter harvesting (using API) in progress Interested in using this data in your research? Please let us know!

item.title: News
item.description: Canada Games in the news 2021 Date Title Publication 03/08/2021 Canada Summer Games to leave an enduring legacy for Niagara St. Catharines Standard

item.title: Starting the New Year with a New Site
item.description: This site has been a work-in-progress for a while, but I’m happy to have it out the door and into the wild. It will serve as a main hub for Niagara 2022 Stories content, and a way of showcasing content aggregated via social media and through our digital exhibits platform, Omeka. More content to come!
